title: Data Analyst
description: Benefits: Competitive salary The role of the Data Analyst is to provide data analysis support for the Office of Education Through Employment Pathways, which is located within the Office of the Deputy Mayor for Education. This is a highly skilled position and familiarity with educational data and policies is required. The position will require the resource to produce data analysis, with a focus on education and workforce-related data sets, and to produce public-facing write ups of the data analysis that share key data insights in accessible language for the public. The Data Analyst shall have knowledge and expertise with R and Tableau. The role will involve working closely across education and workforce agency teams. The ETEP Data Analyst should possess extremely strong written and verbal communication skills and be able to address both business and technical audiences. Duties: Analyzes information and statistical data to prepare reports and studies for use by professionals. Creates charts and graphics to present statistical analysis in an easily digestible format for a non-technical audience Create public-facing written reports to present analytic findings to the public in accessible language Plans, organizes, and conducts research focused on education and workforce related topics. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements: Master’s degree in Data Analytics or related field, or equivalent experience Experience working in R required Experience of working with business stakeholders to support their data needs. Experience presenting technical information to non-technical audiences Experience working with education and workforce-related data preferred
summary: This Data Analyst role supports the Office of Education Through Employment Pathways, analyzing education and workforce data, creating reports, and presenting insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. Proficiency in R and Tableau is essential, along with strong communication skills.

title: Sr. Data Analyst
description: • 8-10+ years of experience as Business/Data Analyst and overall progressive experience supporting a divisional/enterprise data driven initiatives • Production Support of systems • Experience with Data flux & SAS, Unix, SQL, - Python is a nice-to-have. • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (PPT, Excel, Visio etc.) • Overseeing development Data flux jobs: Conceptualization, impact analysis, requirements gathering, process documentation and change management. • Managing the pipeline of work associated with Data flux and prioritizing / assigning work to team members • Creating and delivering status reports to senior management • Support SOX audit processes • Driving high level strategy and approach for supporting and increasing adoption of Data flux and communicating the strategy to the stakeholders • Acting as the main point of contact between the Data flux team and outside groups (both IT support groups and business stakeholders) • Developing and maintaining a productive working relationship with high-level portfolio/project sponsors, key client contacts and workstream leads to ensure cohesive execution • Synthesizing information from multiple workstreams / partners to create a unified program plan • Overseeing and tracking each phase of project creation process (i.e., conceptualization through ongoing support/change management) in order to ensure teamwide deliverables are met • Establishing and continually refining internal team processes in order to deliver on communicated deadlines / promote transparency into the work being performed • Contributing to the creation of weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, and ad hoc status reporting • Identifying risks and issues; establish mitigation plan to facilitate issue resolution • Experience setting team priorities and individual team member priorities • Proven track record of managing multiple program workstreams • Demonstrated flexibility and adaptability to changes • Experience establishing internal processes to manage work associated with multiple workstreams / objectives • Background with Accounting and Financials a plus (i.e., reconciliations)
summary: This role requires a senior Business/Data Analyst with extensive experience in production support of systems, data driven initiatives, and managing data flux projects. Strong communication and leadership skills are essential to oversee development, manage pipelines, prioritize work, and create status reports for senior management. Additionally, the candidate should be proficient in various tools including Data flux, SAS, Unix, SQL, Python (optional), and Microsoft Office Suite. Experience with SOX audit processes, stakeholder management, and establishing internal processes for project management is highly valued.

title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
description: Brief Description As the Data Analyst , you will serve as a technical and subject-matter expert responsible for developing, maintaining, and analyzing routine and ad hoc reports, as well as communicating actionable insights to audiences inside and outside Moore. The ideal candidate must be a strategic thinker able to thrive in a fast-paced, creative, entrepreneurial environment and comfortable with a varied set of data sources and reporting tools, passionate about connecting data with business results. Moore is a data-driven constituent experience management (CXM) company achieving accelerated growth for clients through integrated supporter experiences across all platforms, channels and devices. We are an innovation-led company that is the largest marketing, data and fundraising company in North America serving the purpose-driven industry with clients across education, association, political and commercial sectors. CDR Division is a group of thinkers and doers who help nonprofits motivate and engage minds through multi-channel fundraising, so they can change the world. Experienced and savvy, we build smart, actionable fundraising and engagement strategies that help organizations to inspire, educate, advocate, and fundraise. And we have successfully helped our clients build and implement transformative integrated fundraising programs that have doubled, tripled, and quadrupled the net funds raised. Check out www.WeAreMoore.com for more information. Your impact: Provides standard, ad hoc, and custom reporting using Moore’s proprietary products, developed and managed with Microsoft Power BI. Develops, maintains, and troubleshoots custom dashboards and reports. Works with agency team members and partners to interpret results, make strategic recommendations, and design new solutions. Collects and analyzes datasets using Excel, MS Access, R, SQL, Power BI and other tools and languages as required. Serves as an internal resource for technical and substantive training and questions. Identifies areas for statistical innovation or process improvement, performs independent research, develops innovative approaches, processes, or code. Your Profile: 2+ years of experience as a marketing data analyst with a non-profit organization or an agency that provides direct marketing services to non-profit organizations. Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, marketing, economics, management information systems, or related field. Additional work experience may satisfy the education requirement. Proficiency with data analysis and visualization in Excel, MS Access, and reporting platforms that sit atop multiple database and non-database sources. Experience with multiple CRMs used in nonprofit fundraising, such as Aegis, DMI, Blackbaud CRM, Salesforce, and Raiser’s Edge, as well as eCRMs and tools such as Luminate, Classy, Salsa, ActiveCampaign, and MailChimp. Experience in the use of Microsoft Power BI desktop, with knowledge and experience loading and transforming data within the tool and writing and editing DAX programming. Familiarity with fundraising metrics, file segmentation techniques, and direct marketing strategy across multiple channels. Proven ability to perform analytic tasks (including but not limited to data mining, segmentation, randomized test design, forecasting, data visualization, etc.) and creating meaningful outputs. Excellent written, oral, interpersonal and presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with clients and internal teams. How We’ll Support you: Join the largest marketing and fundraising company in North America serving the nonprofit industry where we prioritize innovation and professional growth. Collaborate with industry subject matter experts with over 5,000 employees across the enterprise. To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including comprehensive healthcare, paid holidays and generous paid time off so you can have the time and space to recharge pursue your other passions and be with the people you care about. Moore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
summary: Data Analyst position at Moore, a CXM company serving nonprofits. Responsibilities include developing, maintaining, and analyzing reports, communicating insights, and collaborating with team members. Ideal candidate has 2+ years of experience in nonprofit marketing data analysis, proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools, CRM experience, and Microsoft Power BI expertise.

title: Data Analyst
description: Position: Data Analyst Location: 100% Remote Are you looking for a growth opportunity for a reputable company with a positive work environment? Job Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field. Proven experience in data modeling, manipulation, and analytics. Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation; familiarity with NoSQL databases is a plus. Strong programming skills in R or Python for advanced modeling and analysis. Experience in creating interactive dashboards and visualizations using PowerBI or similar tools. Familiarity with version control systems such as Git/DevOps. Data Validation and Integrity: Perform data validation and integrity checks to ensure accuracy and reliability of analysis results. Implement measures to maintain data quality and consistency. Maintenance and Documentation: Document data models, ETL processes, and analysis methodologies for knowledge sharing and future reference. Develop and maintain ETL processes to automate data pipelines. Design and build interactive dashboards in PowerBI for stakeholders. Conduct descriptive analytics to track KPIs and visualize trends. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliverables. Perform data validation and integrity checks to ensure data quality. title: Data Analyst
description: Job Identification Job Title: Data Analyst Department: Accounting Reports to Assistant Controller – E-Commerce Location: Alexandria, VA Grade: 17 FLSA Status: Exempt Statement of Purpose Collects and analyzes E-Commerce accounts payable and purchase order exception data, identifying recurring problems and process and resolving exception data to ensure the full cycle of E-Commerce orders is complete within Oracle. Business Communications Employees in Other Divisions Frequently Supervisory Personnel/Management Frequently NIB Associated and SourceAmerica Agencies Frequently E-Commerce Vendors Frequently Education Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited university or college or equivalent work experience preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience may also be acceptable. SQL Certification is preferred. Training and Specialized Knowledge Excellent Excel skills Excellent organizational and communication skills Proficiency with MS Word and other accounting software Proficiency with SQL Familiarity with Oracle Database Architecture Core Competencies Accountability Communication Skills Ethics/Integrity Customer Care Job Knowledge/Technical Skills Process Improvement Experience Experience with EDI processes in a high-volume environment. Two to Three years of E-Commerce experience Two to Three years plus of Oracle EBS experience Extensive SQL experience Travel Required Minimal Specific Duties And Responsibilities Supports internal and external stakeholders via analysis of the EBS database. title: Data Analyst (DEI)
description: TQI Solutions seeks proactive, visionary thought leaders to drive impactful solutions for clients. We value our team, offering work-life balance, excellent benefits, and career growth. Join us and immerse yourself in a rewarding experience like no other. We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to support the development of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Tableau dashboard through final development tasks, validations, testing, and preparation for launch and change management with users. The ideal candidate will have experience with Tableau for development activities and Tableau Prep to complete validation tasks and ETL from ADE or other external source systems/data extracts. Additionally, the candidate should possess functional skills to convey status to the internal DTO team and client, and to assist in developing technical/change management documentation for deployment and roll-out. This position is in Arlington, VA with the ability for a hybrid work schedule. REMOTE WORK IS NOT AUTHORIZED. Job Responsibilities Utilize Tableau and Tableau Prep to complete development tasks and validate dashboard outputs. Build new ETL outputs based on new data sources such as ADE, external data sources, or data extracts. Ensure data integrity by validating underlying data and updating data source paths as necessary. Collaborate with stakeholders to lead technical reviews and provide status reporting through formal documentation and client presentations. Apply data engineering and data architecture principles to join multiple data sources into accurate and efficient data models for dashboard rendering. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree preferred. US Citizenship Required: Due to the nature of work on a Federal Contract, applicants must be United States citizens. Preferred experience in Authoritative Data Environment (ADE) or ADVANA Jupiter, and with Navy systems. 2+ years’ experience in Tableau development and Tableau Prep. Experience with data engineering, ETL methodology, and creating data models. Ability to communicate effectively with clients and stakeholders. title: Data Analyst
description: ROLE We are seeking a Data Analyst for the Department of Justice (DOJ), Executive Office of the United States Attorneys (EOUSA). The Executive Office for United States Attorneys’ (EOUSA) mission is to provide general executive assistance and direction, policy development, administrative management direction and oversight, operational support, and liaison services for the 94 United States Attorneys’ Offices (USAOs). As part of this mission, EOUSA provides financial litigation guidance and services to the USAOs. EOUSA is the lead component of the Department of Justice (DOJ) for issues relating to financial litigation and the enforcement of criminal debt. Your role as Data Analyst for EOUSA will be to support the FLPs by providing a wide variety of clerical and administrative assistance. This is a full-time opportunity. We can offer job security and stability, a competitive salary, and a comprehensive benefits package. Apply today! Responsibilities Review incoming material and create routine and complex debt records. Enter data into database for cases such as special assessment, fines, restitution, and joint and several debts. Perform on-line data searches to retrieve documentation and analyze data from multiple sources. Compile case-related information to ensure a complete debt record in the database. Submit the completed case information to the appropriate district’s FLP. Conduct quality control review of team members’ work to ensure data accuracy in the database. Research and post payments to ensure timely posting to debts in the database. Review reports to identify expired debts to be closed in the database according to established procedures. Enter event codes associated with enforcement actions into the database to reflect accurate accomplishments. Generate documents that do not require legal interpretation but consider the case’s nature and status. Create and manipulate spreadsheets to track assignments or review and analyze management reports. Work with Office of Legal Programs management, Government officials, and/or delinquent judgment debtors. Perform other related duties as assigned. Required Education/Certifications Possess a high school diploma, four-year undergraduate degree is preferred, Along with diploma, a minimum of one (1) year of data entry work experience. Required Skills/Experience Attention to detail and quality control techniques to ensure accuracy. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office software programs (i.e., Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook) Proficient in accessing, learning, and maintaining various databases and on-line resource search engines. Can Operate personal computers, photocopiers, telephone systems, and scanners. Can edit, reformat, and generate documents using MS Word and other document generation software. title: Data Analyst
description: Hybrid | Washington D.C. | 3-4 days a week Onsite Active Top Secret Clearance Required - Ability to obtain a SCI Summary Our client is an employee and Service-Disabled, Veteran-owned Small Business focused on providing niche technical services. They are a team of experienced Cyber Security professionals with a track record of success in the Federal, Commercial, and Academic workspaces. As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive operations and decision-making. Your in-depth knowledge and experience in manipulating, statistically analyzing, and visualizing mission data will be essential to our team’s ability to uncover trends, identify opportunities, and optimize processes. You will regularly think critically and devise innovative solutions to expedite and enhance complex data challenges for mission end users. You will work with highly technical data science teams and functional stakeholders, and your ability to speak and work in a shared language with them will be invaluable. Perform ad-hoc analysis using Python to support specific intelligence questions and projects Collect, clean, and preprocess large datasets from various sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform decision-making Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and functional stakeholders, to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights Utilize statistical methods and software tools to analyze data and support decision-making processes Create and maintain documentation of data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings Ensure data security and compliance with relevant data protection regulations and requirements Requirements Experience writing functional Python code to automate routine tasks and explore and analyze data Experience visualizing data to understand trends, patterns, and elucidate insights Ability to gather requirements for analytics that augment and/or enhance mission tradecraft Familiarity with cloud computing and services, particularly AWS Excellent technical troubleshooting and process implementation skills Exceptional customer service and team collaboration skills Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment Ability to be on-site 60% of the time at a client SCIF located in Washington D.C. Preferred Requirements Hands-on experience working in Cloud environments, particularly AWS Hands-on experience training, selecting, and evaluating machine learning models Familiarity and experience with the Intelligence Community (IC), and the intel cycle Familiarity and experience with the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Master's degree or equivalent experience in a related field Experience working with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment Relevant certifications Education/Certification Requirements A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience is required Clearance Requirements Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; an active Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a SCI is required. RP is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to support a federal organization. The contractor shall provide written reports for all data analytics conducted regarding the OAI Program. This position is contingent upon award. Responsibilities: Perform data analysis, data mining, reporting, and program development for designated content areas Use standard data collection tools, and statistical methods to analyze data Plan and conduct various and extensive methods of data collection using advanced sampling techniques Design and implement major statistical methodological studies and continuous recurring studies using established statistical methods. Prepare the results of studies and data requests for appropriate audiences. title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Job Description: We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly analytical Senior Data Analyst to join our team and play a crucial role in interpreting data to make informed business decisions. This position will involve collecting, processing, and performing statistical analyses on large datasets. You will turn data into actionable insights that will help drive our business strategies and objectives. Key Responsibilities Data Collection and Cleaning: Gather data from primary and secondary sources; clean and preprocess the data to prepare it for analysis. Statistical Analysis and Data Interpretation: Apply statistical analysis techniques to interpret data and analyze results using statistical tools. Reporting and Visualization: Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to present findings in a visually compelling format. Use visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI to enhance the accessibility of complex data. Predictive Analytics: Utilize predictive modeling techniques to forecast company performance and provide business insights. Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with stakeholders across the company, including marketing, sales, finance, and operations teams, to gather requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations. Process Improvement: Continually enhance data collection and analysis processes, implementing new data analysis techniques and technologies where applicable. Data Management: Manage data sets and ensure data integrity and security across all data platforms. Qualifications Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field. Experience: 1-3 years of experience in a data analysis or related role. Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R. Experience with data visualization software like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. Compensation Salary: Depending on experience, location, and company size. Benefits: Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance; 401(k) plan with company match; paid time off; and professional development opportunities.
summary: We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to collect, process, analyze large datasets, create reports and visualizations, and provide actionable insights to drive business decisions. This role involves data collection, cleaning, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, communication, and process improvement.

title: Intelligence Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Intelligence Data Analyst Location: Sterling, VA Job Type: Full-Time, On-Site About Our Client: They are a well-established enterprise IT solutions firm with a strong focus on government-based projects. With a proven track record of year-over-year growth and an expanding customer base, they are experiencing internal hyper-growth. Due to their immense growth they are now seeking a highly skilled Intelligence Data Analyst to join their team and support our continued success. Clearance Requirements: Eligibility for DHS/ICE clearance or current clearance. U.S. Citizenship required. Key Responsibilities: Advanced Data Analytics: Utilize Business Intelligence (BI) and other supported analytics tools to create reports, support anomaly detection, predictive analysis, and outlier detection. Pattern Analysis: Perform detailed pattern, trend, and link analyses in collaboration with HSI special agents and law-enforcement partners. Identify significant patterns and anomalies in data related to illicit opioid trafficking and work collaboratively to advance investigations. System Proficiency: Demonstrate knowledge of ICE and HSI law-enforcement systems to optimize data analysis and utilization. Focused Operational Analysis: Conduct detailed data analyses concentrating on precursor chemical shipments and associated data patterns to aid HSI operations. Publication of Analytical Products: Produce and disseminate analytical products through HSI’s digital platforms such as SharePoint, ICM, RAVEn, ensuring all relevant stakeholders are well informed. Data Set Expertise: Demonstrate familiarity with essential datasets, such as trade, financial, communication, and supply chain data, to identify networks, detect patterns, and support anomaly detection concerning precursor chemical shipments. Responsive Analytical Support: Provide prompt analytical support for Requests for Assistance from HSI field offices to facilitate ongoing investigations. Information De-confliction: Manage and resolve overlaps in law-enforcement sensitive information to streamline investigative processes. Comprehensive Data Handling: Extract data from various sources, including law enforcement databases and open-source information, to ensure accurate results and insights. Investigative Analysis Support: Evaluate the significance of collected data, extract and disseminate critical information, identify investigative leads, and provide comprehensive support to HSI program managers or case agents. Skills and Qualifications: Solid foundation in statistics and practical experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS). Mastery in data analysis languages, including SQL, Python, or R. Exceptional analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, and present substantial data sets with precision and thoroughness. Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights. Superior communication and presentation capabilities, adept at simplifying complex data insights for non-technical audiences. Required skills include RAVEn, SEACATS, CBP UPAX (analysis tool for passenger travel), ICM (federal analytics tool), and federal experience. Why Join Our Client: Our client values innovation, dedication, and the drive to excel. They offer a dynamic and supportive work environment where your contributions are recognized and your career growth is prioritized. Join our clients team to make a meaningful impact on critical government projects and advance your career with a leader in IT solutions. How to Apply: If you meet the above requirements and are excited about the opportunity to work with a leading IT solutions firm, please submit your resume!
summary: Intelligence Data Analyst needed for a well-established IT solutions firm working on government-based projects. This role involves analyzing data related to illicit opioid trafficking and precursor chemical shipments, creating reports, and providing support to HSI agents and program managers. Requires strong analytical skills, data analysis languages (SQL, Python, R), and familiarity with law enforcement databases and systems.

title: Data Analyst
description: The Talent Acquisition department hires qualified candidates to fill positions which contribute to the overall strategic success of Howard University. Hiring staff “for fit” makes significant contributions to Howard University’s overall mission. At Howard University, we prioritize well-being and professional growth. Here Is What We Offer Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, plus mental health support Work-Life Balance: PTO, paid holidays, flexible work arrangements Financial Wellness: Competitive salary, 403(b) with company match Professional Development: Ongoing training, tuition reimbursement, and career advancement paths Additional Perks: Wellness programs, commuter benefits, and a vibrant company culture Join Howard University and thrive with us! https://hr.howard.edu/benefits-wellness Basic Function The position is for a skilled data manager with a background in data science, population health statistics, and health information technology. The Data Analyst will be responsible for quantitative data collection and summarization of data. The Analyst will generate the coding to create outcomes reports and project dashboards to monitor progress toward goals. The Data Analyst will serve as a consultant to researchers to develop and execute data analysis plans. Will also work closely with clinical quality improvement teams. Skills And Abilities Sets clear objectives, maintains effective communication, and instills in others the desire to accomplish objectives. Analyzes problems, reaches sound conclusions, and presents solutions effectively. Demonstrates commitment to the mission and image of the institution and promotes the same through objectives and operations of the program. Uses sound judgments in decision making. Maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders to facilitate program goals and vision. Ensures that activities are informed by ethnically, culturally, and linguistically diverse perspectives. Contributes to team and provides leadership to accomplish program goals Key Duties and Responsibilities Data Management Works with the operations team and clinic staff to assure efficient data collection in compliance with all prevailing internal and external policies and regulations Assists clinical data team to improve clinical data procurement and processing Assures accuracy and reliability of patient health record data Ensures data integrity, safety, security and compliance Collaborates with clinical operations and health information systems teams to deploy new software (Tableau) Oversees data acquisition via export from electronic health records and import to analytic and visualization software Works closely with business intelligence team to align program needs and organizational policies and procedures for data acquisition and use Works with internal and external stakeholders to optimize hardware and software acquisition and utilization 40% Data Analysis Serves as a statistical consultation to students, faculty, and staff. Assists in designing protocols, developing data analysis plans for health-related research. Assists with data coding and data entry procedures. Analyze clinical or survey data using statistical approaches such as longitudinal analysis, mixed effect modeling, logistic regression analyses, and model building techniques. Analyze archival data such as birth, death, and disease records. Designs, develops, tests, implements and evaluates analytic strategies to support clinical quality assurance and quality improvement goals Establishes and monitors key performance metrics Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies 40% Technical Support and Reporting Plans and generates narrative and quantitative reports to support program goals Maintains and regularly reports activities, progress, and outcomes Provides weekly progress reports of results, barriers, and mitigation Trains team members and provides technical support in data analysis methods and software Researches and recommends new technologies to enhance team performance Participants in trainings to advance personal knowledge and skills related to program objectives 20% QUAILIFICATIONS Education: Bachelors in field related to health information systems or health administration. May substitute experience for education. Experience At least 1 year of experience with data analysis and experience with some of the primary software packages used in research including: SPSS, Tableau, R, STATA, SAS, REDCap, and Qualtrics. At least 1 year SQL preferred. Strong data analysis background. Experience working in a healthcare setting .and/or public health informatics. Excellent communication skills (written & oral). Proficient in Microsoft software programs (i.e., Word, Excel, etc.). Technical skills include knowledge of database languages such as SQL, R, or Python; spreadsheet tools such as REDCap, Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets; and data visualization software such as Tableau or Qlik. Mathematical and statistical skills are also valuable to help gather, measure, organize, and analyze data. Please note: This position description should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as may be required. The university has the right to revise this position description at any time. This position description is not be construed as a contract for employment. Compliance Salary Range Disclosure Expected Pay Range: $67,273 - $74,000
summary: Howard University seeks a skilled Data Analyst with experience in data science, population health statistics, and health information technology to manage data, analyze research, and create reports. The ideal candidate will have at least 1 year of experience with data analysis, statistical software (SPSS, Tableau, R, STATA, SAS, REDCap, Qualtrics), and SQL. Strong communication and technical skills are essential, as well as a background in healthcare or public health informatics.

title: Data Analyst - Entry Level
description: Position Description: We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting business analyses and studies, needs assessments, requirements analysis/definition, and cost/benefit analyses to align business systems, solutions, and initiatives.Responsibilities Candidate will be responsible for conducting business analyses and studies, needs assessments, requirements analysis/definition, and cost/benefit analyses to align business systems, solutions, and initiatives. title: Data Analyst
description: Description At MetaPhase, we believe Quirky is Cool and being authentic is the only way to be! We take the work we do very seriously and do a lot of important mission-focused work for our clients. We are individuals with different passions and strengths who take as much joy in the work we do as from those we work with. Today, we have a team that is invested in creating new solutions that lean forward, challenge the status quo, but also reflect our intimate knowledge of our customers’ business. Over the years, we have fostered a culture in which we are united by shared values—passion, solidarity, generosity, curiosity, and boldness—and these come alive in the work we do and how we do it. Together, we know our people are our difference—for our clients and our colleagues. Are you ready to: Work alongside a dedicated and diverse set of people to offer honest advice and practical guidance to our clients? Learn and grow by taking advantage of every opportunity available to you? Join a company which prides itself on its shared values and inclusive culture? Be the difference and make it happen? Role Summary MetaPhase supports FEMA’s Grant Programs Directorate to help communities secure funding to prepare themselves against acts of terror and other catastrophic events. MetaPhase Consulting is seeking a junior to mid-level data analyst with 3+ years’ work experience to serve as the “go to” for all things data supporting the FEMA team at MetaPhase. Whether that is streamlining processes to extract, transform, and load data, building dashboards to help visualize project milestones, advising on data strategy, or developing methodologies to equitably distribute grant funds, the team member will serve as a valued and trusted partner to a quickly growing team. The successful candidate will support a team of contractors to triage multi-dimensional tasks and be comfortable in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. What You Will Be Doing Work with federal clients and programmatic subject matter experts to frame problems and translate requirements into data-driven solutions. Employ visualization tools such as Power BI and Excel charts. Use SQL to query databases and R or Python to perform data analysis. Support data gathering, reporting, analysis, and verification in support of data quality. Identify tools and technology to help to eliminate manual data entry and/or inefficient ETL processes. Conduct special projects, research, analysis, and develop reports. What We Need From You (Required) A minimum of 3 years of direct experience in data analytics; a minimum of 2 years working in federal consulting or other client facing roles. Ability to gather non-technical requirements, frame problems, and present data-driven solutions. Ability to communicate orally and in writing with non-technical stakeholders Expert proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Power BI and Tableau Understand database structures and data models. Experience with working with SQL U.S. Citizenship required. Bonus Points (Desired) Python or R Jupiter Analytics Microsoft Power Platform Work Location Hybrid, MPC Headquarters (Reston, VA), and FEMA Headquarters (400 C. St. SW, Washington, DC) Travel Up to 10% Education Level Bachelor’s degree Clearance Level Successful adjudication of FEMA suitability. US Citizenship is required. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is 65k-122k. About MetaPhase Consulting MetaPhase Consulting is different with a purpose - demonstrating a new approach to the industry that puts employees and culture first! We continue to be recognized by industry as one of the fastest growing and most impactful consultancies in the nation, and are aggressively hiring to grow our team: Fastest Growing Inc 5000 Fastest Growing Company - 2020, 2021, 2022 Washington Technology Fast 50 Award - 2020, 2021 Financial Times America's Fastest Growing Companies – 2021, 2022 Best Places to Work Washington Post Best Places to Work – 2022, 2023 Washington's Business Journal’s Best Places to Work – 2021, 2022 Virginia Business Magazine's Best Places to Work – 2021, 2022, 2023 Northern Virginia Technology Council Top 100 Technology Firms – 2020 Company & Individual Awards 2021 Washington Business Journal Small Business - CEO of the Year 2021 FedScoop 50 - Industry Leadership Award Nominee 2021, 2023 Moxie Award Finalist 2022 SECAF Government Contractor Awards ($27.5 to $50 Million in Revenue) 2022 FedScoop Best Bosses Finalist – Brett McLaren 2022 Washington Business Journal 40 under 40 – Brett McLaren 2022 FedHealth IT and G2XChange Women in in Leadership Awards – Beth Angerman 2022 George Mason University Prominent Patriots in Business – Fred Costa 2022 TiE DC Capital ELITE Award 2023 Elev8 Gov Con Finalist 2023 Consulting Magazine Leaders in Technology Finalist – Alexa Tsui (Mentor of the Year Award) 2023 Maryland Tech Council ICON Awards Finalist for Government Contracting Company of the Year: Over $50 Million MetaPhase Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, or any other factors protected by federal, state, or local law.

The role involves data analysis, visualization, reporting, and identifying solutions for data-related challenges. This individual will work with federal clients, subject matter experts, and a team of contractors to deliver data-driven solutions.

title: Data Analyst
description: Sr. Data Analyst (Predictive Modeling) Location: Hybrid in Vienna, VA (2 days onsite & 3 remote) M-F Initial Contract is 10 months (through October 2025) Overview Our client, a leading Fortune 100 Credit Union, is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Sr. Data Analyst to join their dynamic team. This role is pivotal in building and enhancing statistical and predictive models for risk-based quantitative analysis. The Sr. Data Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, machine learning engineers, and data visualizers, to deliver impactful projects. Responsibilities include developing proofs of concept, creating communication strategies for various management levels, and implementing analytics systems to address complex problems with simple frameworks. The ideal candidate will possess advanced skills in SQL and Excel, a strong understanding of database design and data modeling, and the ability to develop effective data visualization strategies. Responsibilities Build and enhance statistical and predictive models for risk-based quantitative analysis. Applies scientific, data mining, and statistical theory and methods to test hypotheses using structured and unstructured data. Partner with a cross-functional team of data engineers, machine learning engineers, and data visualizers to deliver projects. Develops proofs of concept or demonstrations to evaluate feasibility of project solutions and recommends visualization strategies. Develop communication strategies of concepts and results for multiple levels of management and technical expertise. Develop, implement, and maintain analytics systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks. Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex datasets. Evaluate organizational methods and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for datasets. Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization. Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data. Perform other duties as assigned. Requirements And Qualifications Candidates are required to be legally authorized to work in the United States without a sponsoring employer indefinitely. *We can only accept the following at this time: US Citizens, GC EAD's, GC Holders, TN Visas. Must be able to work a W2 Contract, we can't do C2C arrangements. Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or a related field. Proficiency in mathematical principles and concepts, and familiarity with scientific and engineering disciplines for complex statistical analysis. Technical writing experience in queries, reports, and presentations. Strong SQL and Excel skills with a readiness to learn other analytics tools. Solid understanding of database design, data mining, and data modeling concepts. Proven capability in developing effective data visualization strategies. Advanced communication skills to convey technical and non-technical information clearly to all management levels. Desired Attributes Doctorate degree in a related field. Advanced proficiency with SQL, Python, Jupyter Notebook/Lab, Visual Studio Code, and other statistical analysis tools. Experience with data visualization applications like PowerBI and Plotly. Familiarity with Agile principles and tools like Azure DevOps. Experience working with Cybersecurity Frameworks and related data. #DICE
summary: A leading Fortune 100 Credit Union is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to build and enhance statistical and predictive models for risk-based quantitative analysis. This role involves collaborating with data engineers, machine learning engineers, and data visualizers. The ideal candidate will have advanced skills in SQL and Excel, a strong understanding of database design and data modeling, and the ability to develop effective data visualization strategies.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: 16+years of experience. Coordinates IT project management, engineering, maintenance, QA, and risk management The Data Steward Will Play a Critical Role To Support The Work Of The Program Administration, Executive Steering Committee And Stakeholders. The Data Steward Is Responsible For: Operational Oversight One of the key duties of the Data Stewards is overseeing the life cycle of a data. Specifically, the Data Steward is responsible for defining and implementing policies and procedures for the day-to-day operational and administrative management of systems and data —including the intake, storage, processing, and transmission of data to internal and external systems. As a part of the oversight for institutional data, the Data Steward must be accountable to define and document data and terminology ina relevant glossary. This includes ensuring that each critical data element has a clear definition and is still in use. Responsible for developing and implementing strategies to assess and develop rules to maintain the quality, integrity and reliability of data. Coordinate cross-agency efforts and decisions that ensure official agency records requirements, privacy, security and other related requirements are met. Provide oversight to ensure the data issues, needs and requirements are documented. Data Quality The Data Steward is ultimately responsible for establishing data-quality metrics and requirements, including defining the values, ranges, and parameters that are acceptable for each data element. They also work with the Data Research, Analytics, and Management team to establish procedures for detection and correction of data-quality issues and collaborate to establish policies, procedures, and internal controls affecting the quality of data. In addition, the Data Steward engages in the ongoing and detailed evaluation of data quality, the identification of anomalies and discrepancies, and the contribution of expertise to understand the root cause and implement corrective measures. Coordinate with program teams and Stakeholder Agencies to ensure the quality and integrity of the data elements (both content and metadata). Facilitate the creation of data standards based on business rules, data access security requirements, and retention of legacy data. Privacy, Security, and Risk Management One of the most critical aspects for the Data Stewards is the protection of data. The incumbent must establish guidelines and protocols that govern the proliferation of data to ensure that privacy controls are enforced in all processes. To be effective, the Data Steward must compile retention, archival, and disposal requirements and ensure compliance with institutional policy and regulations. Accordingly, the Data Steward will establish and implement data curation practices to ensure that the life span of data is commensurate with requirements. However, the Data Steward must protect data while striking a balance between transparency and privacy. Review agency and interagency data-related work products. Coordinate cross-agency efforts and decisions that ensure official agency records requirements, privacy, security and other related requirements are met for data. Policies and Procedures The Data Steward defines policies and procedures for access to data, including the criteria for authorization based on role and/or the individual. Working closely with IT, Privacy and PMO to establish controls, the Data Steward evaluates any suspected or actual breaches or vulnerabilities in confidentiality, integrity, or availability and report them to management or information security personnel. Monitor and analyze the application of federal, state and local data requirements, standards and rules (internal and external). Coordinate efforts with stakeholder agencies to interpret business needs into applications and derive data requirements that represent the business entities' needs regarding accessibility, completeness, timeliness, desired attributes and relationship to other data entities when appropriate Present findings and recommendations to leadership, Executive Steering Committee and other stakeholders regarding recommended changes to improve operating practices, accountability, or transparency. Other duties as assigned. Other Significant Facts Preferred Skills Include: Knowledge of good data management principles, concepts and practices; Knowledge of how to determine business data requirements, create data standards and business rules; Knowledge of human services and health care programs; Ability to work with multiple agency stakeholders that may have common and unique agency or program-specific data requirements; Familiarity with public policy issues related to human services data requirements; Ability to analyze complex, abstract issues in a logical, structured way; Excellent written and oral communication skills Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office(Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook); Knowledge of statistics and/or research methodology. Analytical skills: outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities. Familiarity with business information generation and analysis methods. Ability to effectively drive business, culture and technology change in a dynamic and complex operating environment. Gravitas to develop a framework for information and data governance, as well as to sell and embed it in all levels of the business. Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders, as well as business concepts to technologists; the ability to sell ideas and process internally at all levels, including the board and investors. Demonstrated knowledge of data structure desired, but not essential; information systems/tools, and related software and data management; enterprise content management, and record-keeping policies and practices in a complex organizational environment. Broad experience desired, but not essential, in multiple domain areas, such as data warehousing, business intelligence (BI),data governance, data architecture, data integration, data classification, data strategy, data quality management, data security and privacy, MDM, data standards, regulatory compliance, and enterprise architecture frameworks. Preference for candidates with knowledge and experience with government Responsibilities: CONTRACT JOB DESCRIPTION Coordinates IT project management, engineering, maintenance, QA, and risk management. Plans, coordinates, and monitors project activities. Develops technical applications to support users. Develops, implements, maintains and enforces documented standards and procedures for the design, development, installation, modification, and documentation of assigned systems. Provides training for system products and procedures. Performs application upgrades. Performs, monitoring, maintenance, or reporting on real- time databases, real-time network and serial data communications, and real-time graphics and logic applications. Troubleshoots problems. Ensures project life-cycle is in compliance with District standards and procedures. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related field or equivalent experience
summary: The Data Steward is responsible for overseeing data lifecycle, ensuring data quality, integrity and reliability, managing privacy and security, defining policies and procedures for data access, and working with stakeholders to meet data requirements. They will work closely with IT, Privacy and PMO to ensure data governance and compliance with regulations.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Number: R0199427 Data Analyst The Opportunity: As a data analyst, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. With the abundance of structured and unstructured data, you understand the importance of transforming complex data sets into useful information to solve challenges. As a data analyst at Booz Allen, you can use your skills and experience to support a mission and use data for good. We need a data analyst like you to bring your knowledge to improve the Department of Defense's (DoD) use of installation and operational energy. As a client-facing data analyst on our Defense team, you’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Not only will you provide a deep understanding of their data, you’ll also advise your client on what the information means and how it can be used to make an impact on DoD's full portfolio of energy programs. How You’ll Contribute: As a data analyst on our team, you’ll: Use your technical knowledge and analytical mindset to support client and stakeholder relationships. Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through collection, interpretation, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets. Contribute to impactful work and guide decision-making across multiple organizations. Apply consulting skills and data analytics experience by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience. Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages such as SQL, Python, and R, and Microsoft Office Suite. Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes. Apply data visualization through different formats such as graphs, tables, and PowerPoint slides. Grow your communication and technical skills by merging consulting and big data to create data-centric solutions across mission areas. Work with us to help drive large-scale business and process decisions through data insights. Join us. The world can’t wait. You Have: 5+ years of experience with data analysis Experience with quantitative methods and applied mathematics Experience developing models and simulations and synthesizing information into quantitative and qualitative assessments to support senior leader decision-making Knowledge of DoD organizations and structures Ability to apply the fundamental concepts and techniques of operations research to installation energy and operational energy challenges Ability to obtain a security clearance Bachelor’s degree Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Create Your Career: Grow With Us Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms. A Place Where You Belong Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time. Support Your Well-Being Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home. Your Candidate Journey At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us. Compensation At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page. Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $60,400.00 to $137,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date. Work Model Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely. If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility. If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role. EEO Commitment We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.
summary: Booz Allen Hamilton is seeking a Data Analyst with 5+ years of experience to support the Department of Defense (DoD) in improving their use of installation and operational energy. This role will involve analyzing large data sets, developing models and simulations, and presenting findings to clients and stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of quantitative methods, DoD organizations, and operations research, and be able to obtain a security clearance.

title: Data Analyst
description: ASHLIN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ASHLIN is also an Equal Opportunity of Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. forms for data entry and maintenance by end-users Document data analysis and reporting architecture, designs, and write user guides Other duties as defined by senior research team Qualifications To be Pivot, H-Lookup, V-Lookup, Import/Export from/to external data sources) Online Dashboards (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Sisense) Expert level skills in the development of highly impactful PowerPoint slide In Addition, The Following Are Highly Desirable A minimum of 3 years’ experience with statistical analysis tools (e.g. R, SPSS) A background in market research, or related disciplines Working knowledge of relational databases (e.g. SQL) Position Requirements Include At least a Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Probability & Statistics, or related data science field Master’s degree in any of the above disciplines is highly desirable, or MBA High proficiency with statistical analysis tools Only open to candidates US Citizens and Permanent Residents currently authorized to work in the US

title: Junior Health Data Analyst (HHS)
description: Founded in 2003, IT Concepts' core values - customer-centricity, teamwork, driven to deliver, innovation, and integrity - ensure we work together to be the best, realize objectives, and make a positive impact in our communities. We intentionally created and sustain ITC culture to embrace change, experimentation, continuous learning, and improvement. We bring our design thinking, problem-solving approach that challenges assumptions, prioritizes curiosity, and invites complexity to deliver innovative, efficient, and effective solutions. As we continue to grow in the support of our government customers, we are looking for driven and innovative individuals to join our team. IT Concepts is seeking a junior Health Data Analyst to support our Health & Human Services (HHS), Health Resources & Services Administration (HRSA) Provider Relief Bureau (PRB) client. HRSA is responsible for improving access to healthcare services for underserved and vulnerable populations and has a wide range of responsibilities and programs aimed at enhancing healthcare access and quality in the United States. As a Health Data Analyst (HHS), you will assist the Program team with functional/technical requirements gathering and providing programmatic support, including preparing/maintaining project management artifacts, risk tracking, data analysis, reporting, and optimizing operational processes/templates as needed as we compile and complete data use cases and solution knowledge management needs for the PRB. Responsibilities {{:}} Facilitate and report on functional and technical requirements gathering sessions Create process flow diagrams and wireframes Develop and maintain Use Case templates Complete Gap Analyses Contribute to deliverables with high degree of quality and accuracy Collect, analyze, and maintain project data and documentation. This includes project plans, schedules, budgets, and other documents. Assist in facilitating communication among project stakeholders, ensuring that relevant information is disseminated to the right people at the right time. This can include organizing meetings, creating status reports, and managing communication tools. Ensure that projects adhere to the organization's project management methodologies and standards Assist in resource allocation, tracking resource utilization, and helping project managers ensure the right resources are available for each use case. This can include managing resource calendars and schedules. Demonstrate an understanding of the client environment and overall project scope Create and maintain various reports and dashboards to track project progress, key performance indicators (KPIs), and other metrics. Analyze data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement. Prepare and submit detailed meeting minutes and agendas Maintain a repository of project-related documents, ensuring version control, accessibility, and proper archiving. Contribute to continuous process improvement efforts, helping to identify and implement best practices and efficiency improvements. Work with stakeholders, including project managers, executives, team members, and external partners, to ensure alignment and communication. Document best practices and lessons learned from completed projects to help improve future project management efforts Actively seek opportunities to take on new challenges and increase knowledge of project requirements Location {{:}} Able to work remotely from the United States. Requirements Requirements{{:}} Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, such as Data Science, Public Health, Statistics, or a related degree 2+ years of demonstrated experience working on programs or projects related to public health and requirements gathering Strong understanding of project management processes and experience developing/maintaining standard project management deliverables Exceptional communication skills and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization. This includes written, verbal, and visual communications Interpersonal skills to gather requirements in a cross-functional environment Ability to work in an ambiguous environment and collaborate across multiple areas to achieve a common business objective Preferred{{:}} Experience as a Scrum Master, including Scrum Master certification Experiencing contributing toward a Knowledge Management Solution or System Familiarity with SharePoint or other collaborative environments Experience supporting government public health agency (preferably Department of Health and Human Services) Clearance Requirements{{:}} Must be able to obtain and maintain a public trust clearance Must be a US Citizen Benefits The Company We believe in generating success collaboratively, enabling long-term mission success, and building trust for the next challenge. With you as our partner, let's solve challenges, think innovatively, and maximize impact. As a valued member of our team, you have the unique opportunity to work in a diverse range of technology and business career paths, all while supporting our nation and delivering innovative technology solutions. We are a close community of experts that pride ourselves on creating an environment defined by teamwork, dedication, and excellence. We hold three ISO certifications (27001{{:}}2013, 20000-1{{:}}2011, 9001{{:}}2015) and two CMMI ML 3 ratings (DEV and SVC). Industry Recognition Growth | Inc 5000's Fastest Growing Private Companies, DC Metro List Fastest Growing; Washington Business Journal{{:}} Fastest Growing Companies, Top Performing Small Technology Companies in Greater D.C. Culture | Northern Virginia Technology Council Tech 100 Honoree; Virginia Best Place to Work; Washington Business Journal{{:}} Best Places to Work, Corporate Diversity Index Winner - Mid-Size Companies, Companies Owned by People of Color; Department of Labor's HireVets for our work helping veterans transition; SECAF Award of Excellence finalist; Victory Military Friendly Brand; Virginia Values Veterans (V3); Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Corporate Breath Award Benefits We offer great benefits - Competitive Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Identity Theft Protection, Legal Resources Coverage, 401(k) with company matching with NO vesting period.  ITC Health benefits have a $0 premium for certain plans for eligible employees. We invest in our employees - Every employee is eligible for education reimbursement for certifications, degrees, or professional development.  Reimbursement amounts may fluctuate due to IRS limitations. We want you to grow as an expert and a leader and offer flexibility for you to take a course, complete a certification, or other professional growth and networking. We are committed to supporting your curiosity and sustaining a culture that prioritizes commitment to continuous professional development. We work hard, we play hard. ITC is committed to incorporating fun into every day. We dedicate funds for activities - virtual and in-person - e.g., we host happy hours, holiday events, fitness & wellness events, and annual celebrations. In alignment with our commitment to our communities, we also host and attend charity galas/events. We believe in appreciating your commitment and building a positive workspace for you to be creative, innovative, and happy.
